Subject: Re: [junit] How to test private methods in a class.

Robert Watkins wrote:

> Public interfaces.
> 
> Public factories.
> 
> Package-private implementations, in the package of the factory.
> 

One more related problem with this: you've basically thrown away final. 
It becomes possible to replace any component of the system, and in so 
doing to change the behavior of systems in unexpected and arbitrary 
ways. You can rely on nothing. You can no longer assume that objects do 
what you expect them to. Again, not all languages have this problem with 
interface-based designs; but Java does. :-(

--
